####  Why do some children have asthma? 
One in 4 tamariki in Aotearoa New Zealand will have asthma at some time during childhood. It's not clear why some children have asthma when others don't.
Asthma in children is more likely if:
  * a mother smoked during pregnancy 
  * a child has [eczema](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/e/eczema-children), [hay fever](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/h/hay-fever) or allergies
  * there is asthma in the family â€“ parent, brother or sister
  * one or both parents have an allergic condition, eg, asthma, hay fever or eczema.


Modern Western lifestyle may play a part in the rise in asthma that has happened over the last few decades. Changes in housing, diet and a more hygienic environment may contribute.
